channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL

item.title: Greetings from Jaffa, Israel, where a salon is a welcoming space for Palestinians and Jews
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: When porch pirates steal medicine instead of holiday gifts

item.title: Rain Begins in Southern California as Region Braces for Intense Storm
item.description: Heavy rain, strong winds, flooding and debris flow could affect Los Angeles County and the surrounding areas on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.

item.title: In the snow, these salamanders get supercool
item.description: Blue spotted salamanders have been seen walking across snow and new research suggests how they get by in the cold.

item.title: The Strange Case of the Russian Snickers in U.K. Convenience Shops
item.description: The Russian-labeled candy bars are a reminder of how difficult it is to completely disconnect a major economy from the global flow of goods.

item.title: Zelensky Open to Pulling Back Troops in Eastern Ukraine to Reach Peace Deal With Russia
item.description: The offer was the closest Mr. Zelensky has come to addressing the thorny territorial disputes in Donetsk that have repeatedly derailed peace talks.

item.title: The Truce Is 2 Months Old. So Why Have Hundreds of Gazans Been Killed?
